title.narrative: UNFPA humanitarian action in Afghanistan and the region, 2021

description.narrative: Meeting the objectives of the UNFPA 2021 updated Humanitarian Appeal for Afghanistan and health and protection needs identified in the regional refugee preparedness and response plan with a significant focus to support the protection of women and girls in humanitarian contexts

This allocation contributes to meeting the objectives of UNFPA’s updated humanitarian appeal for Afghanistan and the regional refugee preparedness and response plan for 2021. The grant seeks to support the protection of women and girls in humanitarian contexts.
The UNFPA appeal for Afghanistan seek to target 1,6 million women and children by delivering:
- Lifesaving maternal health care services, including basic emergency obstetric and newborn care, ante-natal and post- natal care services. - Medical and psychosocial support to women and girls - Support to coordination on women’s protection response through the GBV sub-cluster - Maternal health drugs - Tele-initiatives improving access to reproductive health information.
UNFPA response under the regional refugee preparedness and response plan: - Support UNFPA’s response towards the refugee hosting neighbouring countries (Pakistan Iran, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan). Focus for operations will be improving lifesaving maternal health care services and prevention of and response to SGBV.
UNFPA's annual reports are available here: https://afghanistan.unfpa.org/en/publications
